integrations_researched.name: Electron

key_functions: ipcMain.handle(channel, handler) - Handle IPC from renderer
ipcRenderer.invoke(channel, args) - Send IPC to main

infrastructure.notes: Desktop application framework, no server infrastructure needed

gotchas: Must use contextBridge for secure IPC in production (contextIsolation: true)
Main process and renderer process are separate - cannot share state directly
Electron apps need code signing for distribution on macOS/Windows
Large bundle sizes - consider electron-builder for optimized packaging
Node.js integration in renderer is disabled by default for security

gotchas: React 18 requires createRoot instead of ReactDOM.render

key_functions: npx shadcn@latest add button - Add individual components

infrastructure.notes: Component library - code is copied into your project, not installed as dependency

gotchas: ShadCN is NOT a traditional npm package - it copies component code into your project
Requires Tailwind CSS to be set up first
Components are added to src/components/ui/ directory by default
Uses Radix UI primitives under the hood for accessibility
Must configure path aliases (@/components) in tsconfig.json
Each component must be added individually via CLI

key_functions: Utility classes: flex, grid, p-4, m-2, text-lg, bg-blue-500

Unused styles are purged in production - ensure dynamic class names are complete
PostCSS is required for processing
JIT (Just-in-Time) mode is default in v3+
Custom colors/themes go in tailwind.config.js extend section

integrations_researched.name: FastAPI

key_functions: await websocket.send_json(data) - Send JSON via WS
api_patterns.verified_against: Context7 MCP: /websites/fastapi_tiangolo (Benchmark: 96.8) + WebFetch of official docs

infrastructure.notes: Python ASGI framework, runs with uvicorn

gotchas: WebSocket connections need proper disconnect handling with try/except WebSocketDisconnect
In-memory connection list only works single-process; use Redis for multi-process
Use WebSocketException not HTTPException for WebSocket error handling
CORS middleware must be added explicitly for cross-origin requests
Install websockets package separately: pip install websockets
Run with: uvicorn main:app --reload (development) or fastapi dev main.py

integrations_researched.name: MinIO Python SDK

key_functions: client.put_object(bucket, object_name, data, length) - Upload object
client.fget_object(bucket, object_name, file_path) - Download to file
client.presigned_get_object(bucket, object_name, expires) - Get presigned URL

infrastructure.notes: Connects to existing MinIO server at 10.18.136.10:9001 (console) / 9000 (API)

gotchas: API port is typically 9000, console is 9001 - use 9000 for SDK connections
secure=False for HTTP, secure=True for HTTPS
For file uploads, use fput_object for files on disk, put_object for streams
Object data from get_object must be read completely or closed to release connection
Bucket names must be lowercase and DNS-compliant (3-63 chars, no underscores)
Large file uploads should use streaming to avoid memory issues

infrastructure.notes: Connects to existing SQL Server at 10.18.138.240

gotchas: SQL Server requires ODBC driver installed on system
Connection string format: mssql+pyodbc://user:pass@host/db?driver=ODBC+Driver+17+for+SQL+Server
For async, use mssql+aioodbc and create_async_engine
Sessions should be closed/committed properly - use context managers
SQL Server uses NVARCHAR for Unicode strings

dependencies: ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server (system package)

system_packages.windows: Download and install 'Microsoft ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server'
system_packages.linux_ubuntu: curl https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | apt-key add - && apt-get install msodbcsql17

gotchas: Requires ODBC driver installed at OS level - not a Python-only dependency
Driver name must match exactly: 'ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server'
Connection strings are different from SQLAlchemy URLs
Use parameterized queries (?) to prevent SQL injection
For SQLAlchemy, prefer SQLAlchemy's connection management over raw pyodbc

integrations_researched.name: Playwright

imports: from playwright.sync_api import sync_playwright, Page, expect
api_patterns.initialization:
with sync_playwright() as p:
    browser = p.chromium.launch()
    page = browser.new_page()

infrastructure.notes: Playwright installs browser binaries via 'playwright install' command

electron_testing.pattern:
from playwright.sync_api import sync_playwright

with sync_playwright() as p:
    app = p.electron.launch(
        executable_path='/path/to/electron/app'
    )
    window = app.first_window()
    # Test the window like a regular page
    window.click('button#submit')

gotchas: Must run 'playwright install' after pip install to download browsers
Electron testing requires the built Electron app executable
For CI/CD, install browsers in CI: 'playwright install --with-deps chromium'
Use pytest-playwright for better test organization
async API requires async/await syntax
Screenshots and videos can be auto-captured on failure
